method.name: MODL Discretizer

reference.ref: M. Boulle. MODL: A bayes optimal discretization method for continuous attributes. Machine Learning 65:1 (2006) 131-165

generalDescription.objective: To transform a set of numerical variables into nominal variables. Input variables may be either real or integer.
generalDescription.howWork:
MODL Discretizer is an algorithm that discretizes the non nominal attributes (real or integer) of a group of instances.
The task of a discretization algorithm is to build a set of intervals for each non nominal attribute. The value of the attribute is translated to the interval number to which the value belongs.
MODL Discretizer builds the intervals by means of a bottom-up process. Two promising intervals are merged while there is intervals with a size below a threshold, or the merging decreases the MODL value associated to the current discretization scheme.

method.example:
Problem type: Classification Method: MODL Discretizer Dataset: Iris Plants
Input Training set: Iris-10-1tra.dat Input Test set: Iris-10-1tst.dat Output Training set: Disc-MODL.iris-10-1tra.dat Output Test set: Disc-MODL.iris-10-1tst.dat Descriptor: result1e0.txt
Parameters: default values
After the execution of RunKeel.jar we can see into the datasets/Disc-OneR.iris folder the discretization results; 3 files are generated in this folder:
Disc-MODL.iris-10-1tra.dat: @relation iris @attribute sepalLength {0,1,2,3} @attribute sepalWidth {0,1,2,3} @attribute petalLength {0,1,2,3} @attribute petalWidth {0,1,2} @attribute @relation iris @attribute sepalLength {0,1,2,3} @attribute sepalWidth {0,1,2,3} @attribute petalLength {0,1,2,3} @attribute petalWidth {0,1,2} @attribute class{Iris-setosa,Iris-versicolor,Iris-virginica} @inputs sepalLength,sepalWidth,petalLength,petalWidth @outputs class @data 0,2,0,0,Iris-setosa 0,2,0,0,Iris-setosa 2,3,0,0,Iris-setosa 0,2,0,0,Iris-setosa 0,3,0,0,Iris-setosa 2,1,1,1,Iris-versicolor 2,1,1,1,Iris-versicolor 2,1,2,1,Iris-versicolor 2,1,1,1,Iris-versicolor 2,3,1,1,Iris-versicolor 2,2,3,2,Iris-virginica 3,1,3,2,Iris-virginica 2,0,2,1,Iris-virginica 2,2,3,2,Iris-virginica 2,1,2,2,Iris-virginica
